programme.desc: TCU (10-9, 3-5) is 1-7 away from home this season; No. 22 Texas Tech (15-4, 6-2) won four-straight games behind JT Toppin, who is fourth in the Big 12 with 16.3 ppg, and won eight of its last nine home meetings with the Horned Frogs.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma and LSU last met on Dec. 7, 2019, where the Sooner claimed a 90-68 victory over the Tigers behind 21 points and 2 steals from Taylor Robertson; Khayla Pointer posted 24 points and 3 assists for LSU in the defeat away from home.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Main event bouts from previous UFC cards are featured to show some of the top matches that have occurred over the years as belts are put on the line, reputations are challenged between longtime rivals and impressive victories are featured.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Yale (11-6, 4-0) won five-straight games behind John Poulakidas, who leads the Ivy League with 19.4 ppg; Princeton (14-5, 3-1) is 6-2 at home behind Xaivian Lee, who is fourth in the Ivy League with 17.2 ppg, and won the last two home meetings.

programme.title: The Domonique Foxworth Show
programme.desc: Former NFL cornerback Domonique Foxworth shares his thoughts on the latest news making headlines from the sport he played, along with reactions to latest around the world of sports and guest interviews to gain a unique perspective.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 19 Memphis (16-4, 6-1) won three-straight games behind PJ Haggerty, who is second in the country in scoring with 22.1 ppg; Tulane (11-9, 5-2) is 9-2 at home, where the Green Wave have won the last three meetings with the Tigers.

programme.title: WNBA Free Agency Special
programme.desc: All of the latest news and reports surrounding the WNBA offseason are explored, including updates on the prized free agents in the class; coverage includes exclusive interviews, in-depth reports from correspondents and expert analysis.

programme.desc: The life and career of Eugene F. "Buddy" Teevens III is celebrated, showcasing the groundbreaking innovations he brought to college football during his coaching tenure which spanned four decades and the impact he made off the field.

programme.desc: Arkansas bested Arknasas in both of their meetings from the 2024 season, claiming a 198.350-197.275 victory in the final matchup on March 10; Ava Siegfeldt and Jordan Bowers posted perfect scores for the Sooners in the win away from home.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston is joined by his friend Garry Mason on a fishing expedition to Missouri in hopes of finding trophy-caliber crappie and bass, discussing the equipment they are using on the trip and their techniques they are implementing to find success.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Ohio State (12-8, 4-5) won its last two games after an 82-65 win over Iowa behind 18 points from Micah Parrish, and won five of the last eight meetings; Penn State (13-8, 3-7) dropped six of its last seven games, but is 10-2 at home.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Xavier (13-8, 5-5) won four of its last five games after a 76-72 win over UConn; Creighton (14-6, 7-2) won five straight behind Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is fourth in the Big East in scoring with 17.7 ppg, and won both meetings last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Xavier (13-8, 5-5) won four of its last five games after a 76-72 win over UConn; Creighton (14-6, 7-2) won five straight behind Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is fourth in the Big East in scoring with 17.7 ppg, and won both meetings last season.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Jakob Butturff earned top seed in the season-opening championship round after 18 games, taking down EJ Tackett and Ryan Barnes in best-of-seven bracket play; the top four seeds each won their respective brackets enroute to the stepladder finals.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UNLV (11-9, 5-4) beat the Aggies, 65-62, on Jan. 15 behind 15 points from Jalen Hill; Utah State (18-2, 8-1) won two straight since the loss to the Rebels, and is 10-1 at home behind Ian Martinez, who is top five in Mountain West scoring with 17 ppg.

programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 18 Illinois (14-6, 6-4) won its last nine meetings with the Cornhuskers after a 98-87 win in the 2024 Big Ten Tournament; Nebraska (12-8, 2-7) dropped its last six games, but is 8-2 at home behind Brice Williams, who leads the team with 18.2 ppg.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series Qualifying
programme.desc: Cup Series drivers qualify for the Cook Out Clash at Bowman Gray Stadium, vying for the fastest times to claim the best possible start positions; Bowman Gray Stadium in North Carolina is back to hosting NASCAR for the first time since 1971.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Indiana (14-7, 5-5) is 3-5 away from home this season; No. 10 Purdue (16-5, 8-2) is 10-1 at home behind Trey Kaufman-Renn, who leads the Boilermakers with 18.1 ppg, and won both meetings with the Hoosiers last season, including a 79-59 home win.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Players bowl three rounds of 24 games across three oil patterns to qualify for round robin play; Graham Fach comes off of returning to the winner's circle in the Delaware Classic at Mid-County Lanes & Entertainment Center in Middletown, Delaware.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Utah claimed a 69-48 victory over Arizona in their first meeting of the season on Dec. 31, led by an 18-point, 9-rebound performance from Gianna Kneepkens; Lauryn Swann posted 22 points and an assist for the Wildcats in the loss at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Xavier (13-8, 5-5) won four of its last five games after a 76-72 win over UConn; Creighton (14-6, 7-2) won five straight behind Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is fourth in the Big East in scoring with 17.7 ppg, and won both meetings last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UNLV (11-9, 5-4) beat the Aggies, 65-62, on Jan. 15 behind 15 points from Jalen Hill; Utah State (18-2, 8-1) won two straight since the loss to the Rebels, and is 10-1 at home behind Ian Martinez, who is top five in Mountain West scoring with 17 ppg.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Jakob Butturff earned top seed in the season-opening championship round after 18 games, taking down EJ Tackett and Ryan Barnes in best-of-seven bracket play; the top four seeds each won their respective brackets enroute to the stepladder finals.

programme.title: Mexican Liga MX Soccer
programme.desc: Jurez has claimed victories over Santos Laguna in three of their last four meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Oct. 6 with a 2-0 scoreline; scar Estupin and Carlos Salcedo found the net for Jurez in the win away from home.

programme.title: 2025 Women's Concacaf U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Trinidad & Tobago (1-0-0) cruised to a 5-0 victory over the U.S. Virgin Islands, 5-0, in Week 1, as Orrielle Martin scored twice in each half to finish with four goals; Belize (0-0-1) comes off a 2-0 loss to Honduras in its Group B opener on Jan. 27.
